remarks: The Hilbert lattice is relatively atomic.  Stronger version of ~ hlrelat .  (Contributed by NM, 2-May-2012.)
statement:
hlrelat3.b $e |- B = ( Base ` K ) $.
hlrelat3.l $e |- .<_ = ( le ` K ) $.
hlrelat3.s $e |- .< = ( lt ` K ) $.
hlrelat3.j $e |- .\/ = ( join ` K ) $.
hlrelat3.c $e |- C = ( <o ` K ) $.
hlrelat3.a $e |- A = ( Atoms ` K ) $.
hlrelat3 $p |- ( ( ( K e. HL /\ X e. B /\ Y e. B ) /\ X .< Y ) -> E. p e. A ( X C ( X .\/ p ) /\ ( X .\/ p ) .<_ Y ) ) $.
$d .< p $.
$d .<_ p $.
$d A p $.
$d B p $.
$d K p $.
$d X p $.
$d Y p $.
